title: On the Hagedorn Behaviour of PP-wave Strings and N=4 SYM Theory at Finite R-Charge Density
abstract: We discuss the high temperature behaviour of IIB strings in the maximally symmetric plane wave background, and show that there is a Hagedorn temperature. Thermodynamic quantities diverge as we approach the Hagedorn temperature from below, suggesting that the Hagedorn temperature is a limiting temperature. We discuss the map between strings in the pp-wave background and the dual superconformal field theory in the thermal domain. The Hagedorn bound describes a curve in the R-charge chemical potential versus temperature phase diagram of the dual Yang-Mills theory, suggesting that the theory dual to the pp-wave string exists only on one side. Yet, the dual theory itself manifestly exists on both sides of the Hagedorn bound. One possibility is that this mismatch is an artifact of the ideal gas approximation, and that for finite coupling the Hagedorn temperature ceases to be limiting.
